text.text: How do I configure the billing process settings in ZOLL Billing, and what options are available?

text: The billing process section defines the clearinghouse you use by their identifier and HMAC. Here you also select the following options: Run patient tasks, Process claim status rules, Submit claims to the clearinghouse, Process clearinghouse remittances.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of the "Run patient tasks" setting in the billing process configuration?

text: The Run patient tasks setting controls when patient invoices are sent. If it is not checked, the claims will sit in queued for submission and an invoice will not be created for the patient.

text.text: What is the purpose of the "Process claim status rules" option in the billing process settings?

text: These are the status change rules such as submitted to follow-up after 30 days, etc.

text.text: How do I enable ZOLL Billing to submit claims to the clearinghouse?

text: To enable ZOLL Billing to submit claims to the clearinghouse, you need to enable the Submit claims to the clearinghouse setting.

text.text: What actions does enabling the "Process clearinghouse remittances" setting allow ZOLL Billing to perform?

text: The Process clearinghouse remittances setting allows ZOLL Billing to Account Letter casing of patient names and addresses.

text.text: How can I change the letter casing of patient names and addresses?

text: To change the letter casing of patient names and addresses, you can enable the UPPERCASE new patient names and addresses setting. This will automatically make all new patient names and addresses uppercase, including those that are manually created or imported. You will also be given a one-time option to change all existing names and addresses to uppercase.

text.text: What options are available for configuring level of service favorites?

text: The following options are available for configuring level of service favorites: Only the level of services that you mark as favorites display in the selection boxes on the Level of service & diagnosis tab when you are working incomplete claims. You can still select a non-favorite level of service by clicking the Sow all box to expand the list.

text.text: Can you guide me through the process of setting up the reporting start date in ZOLL Billing Insights?

text: The reporting start date is used by Insights to determine the date certain reports use when calculating your data. To set up the reporting start date, you can follow these steps: 1. Go to the Configuration page. 2. Click the Reporting Start Date field and select the accounting period date.

text.text: How do I enable and configure the integration with ZOLL Dispatch?

text: To enable and configure the integration with ZOLL Dispatch, you can follow these steps: 1. Go to the Configuration page. 2. Click the Enable integration with ZOLL Dispatch checkbox. 3. Click the Save button. Now, ZOLL Billing will only import files from Dispatch with the call types you specified in the Import box.

text.text: What options are available for filtering call types and vehicles to import from ZOLL Dispatch?

text: To select vehicles to import: 1. In the 'Do not import' box, click a vehicle to highlight. Both inactive and active vehicles can be selected. 2. Use the center arrows to move the call type from the 'Do not import' box to the 'Import' box. 3. Click Save.

text.text: explain the purpose of the billing settings in ZOLL Billing, particularly regarding patient statements?

text: The billing settings in ZOLL Billing are used to determine how often patient statements are sent and how many statements are sent. The settings are located on the Configuration tab under the Patient billing section.

text.text: How does enabling the "Invoice a patient by default" option affect patient billing in ZOLL Billing?

text: The Invoice a patient by default option controls whether or not a patient invoice is created when a claim is submitted. If the option is enabled, a patient invoice will be created when the claim is submitted. If the option is disabled, a patient invoice will not be created when the claim is submitted.

text.text: What is the significance of enabling the "Suspend patient billing by default" option in patient billing settings?

text: When you select this option, anytime a claim is created for a patient or anytime a payment is posted and the claim moves into patient billing, the system automatically suspends the claim with a status of 'Suspended - write - off pending'. You can override this setting by clicking the edit icon next to the status on the Claim page and selecting another status.

text.text: How can I choose a patient statement vendor in ZOLL Billing, and what factors should I consider?

text: There are several patient statement vendors to choose from . This option will be setup during Onboarding . It is recommended that you do not change it unless you consult with ZOLL first .

text.text: What components can be customized on a patient statement in ZOLL Billing?

text:
The following components can be customized on a patient statement in ZOLL Billing:

* Header
* Footer
* Patient information
* Claim information
* Payment information
* Balance information
* Terms and conditions
* Signature line
* Logo

text.text: How does the "Deductible monitoring" feature work in ZOLL Billing, and when might it be useful?

text: Deductible Monitoring can operate automatically, with users defining parameters while the system handles the process, or manually, where the Biller manually adjusts the claim's status. When a Biller is ready to submit a claim, ZOLL Billing checks the patient's deductible status. If the patient's deductible is met, the claim is submitted to the clearinghouse. If the patient's deductible is not met, the claim is suspended and the claim information is sent to AR Boost where the patient will be put in the Deductible Monitoring queue. AR Boost Deductible Monitoring sends a query to the payer on a regular bases asking for deductible information for the patient.

text.text: explain how to enable and utilize the automated payment plan feature

text: To enable the automated payment plan feature, you need to enable the payment plan for the account. You can do this on the Account page by sliding the payment plan toggle to the right. You can also enable the payment plan feature on the Patient responsibility tab. When you enable the payment plan feature, all accounts with payment plans defined and enabled will be automatically monitored to timely payment. You can enter the number of days between the plan payments and then click Save. You can also remove the patient from the plan by clicking the icon under the "Review" column.

text.text: What steps are involved in configuring the number of days between plan payments in ZOLL Billing?

text: To configure the number of days between plan payments in ZOLL Billing, you need to go to the Configuration tab and scroll down to the "Patient billing" section. You can then click on the days field and select a value from the list. You can also click the statement field and select a value from the list.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle accounts with payment plans defined and enabled under the automated payment plan feature?

text: When the automated payment plan feature is enabled, all accounts with payment plans defined and enabled will be automatically monitored for timely payment. You can enter the number of days between plan payments and then click Save. Note: Be careful about the number you enter in number of days field.

text.text: Where can I find more detailed information or resources regarding the features and settings discussed under the Configuration tab?

text: You can find more detailed information or resources regarding the features and settings discussed under the Configuration tab at.

text.text: what are the options in billing process?

text: The billing process section defines the clearinghouse you use by their identifier and HMAC. Here you also select the following options: Run patient tasks: This setting controls when patient invoices are sent. Process claim status rules: These are the status change rules such as submitted to follow-up after 30 days, etc. Submit claims to the clearinghouse: Enable this setting to allow ZOLL Billing to send completed claims to the clearinghouse. Process clearinghouse remittances: Enable this setting to allow ZOLL Billing to Account Letter casing of patient names and addresses.

text.text: explain Letter casing of patient names and addresses

text: The system defaults to the "Leave patient names and addresses unchanged" setting. In this state, you control what to cap and what to leave lower case. If you select "UPPERCASE new patient names and addresses", all new patient names and addresses will change to uppercase. This is true if they are imported or manually created. You have a one-time option under this selection to change all existing names and addresses to uppercase.

text.text: how can i change a patient name in upper case

text: To change a patient name in upper case, you can use the following steps: 1. Hover over Manage on the navigation bar and then click Settings . 2. Click the Configuration tab . Scroll down to the Account section . 3. The system defaults to the " Leave patient names and address unchanged " setting . If you leave this enabled , you will be able to control what to cap and what to leave as lower case . 4. Enabling " UPPERCASE new patient names and addresses " will automatically make all new patient names and address uppercase . This includes all names / address that are manually created or imported . Note : You will be given a one - time option to change all existing names and addresses to uppercase . Be advised that this action cannot be undone .

text.text: HOW TO Enable integration check box?

text: To enable the integration check box, you must check the "Enable integration with ZOLL Dispatch" option. To select call types to import, you can click a call type to highlight in the "Do not import" box.

text.text: How to Enable "Filter by Call Type"?

text: To enable "Filter by Call Type", you must check the "Enable integration with ZOLL Dispatch" option. To select call types to import, you can click a call type to highlight in the "Do not import" box.
